scenarioDescription:
The HD 213885 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 213885 is a star with 1.07 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.1 times its radius. It is located 156.84 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 213885 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 213885 system


HD 213885 b

HD 213885 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 213885 b is 8.834 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 213885 b is 1.745 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 213885 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 213885 c

HD 213885 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2020-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 213885 c is 19.961 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 213885 c is 4.710 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 213885 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 213885, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: HD 213885 - System With 2 Exolanets
